title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 36 (WW1&W
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 36 (WW1&WW2 - 2):

WW1 and WW2 were addressed in Collection 9 of this series. Here we have 28 more titles.

-  Andelman - A Shattered Peace; VERSAILLES 1919 and the Price We Pay Today (2008)

-  Bridgham - The First World War as a Clash of Cultures (2006)

-  Buchanan - Churchill, Hitler, and the Unnecessary War; How Britain Lost Its Empire and the West Lost the World (2008)

-  Clark - Suicide of the Empires; the Eastern Front, 1914-18 (1971)

-  Culpepper - Never Will We Forget; Oral Histories of World War II (2008)

-  Dockrill & Fisher - The Paris Peace Conference, 1919; Peace without Victory (2001)

-  Fleming - The Illusion of Victory; America in World War I (2003)

-  Fleming - The New Dealers' War; F.D.R. and the War within World War II (2001)

-  Fromkin - Europe's Last Summer; Why the World Went to War in 1914 (2004)

-  Hart - The Great War (2013)

-  Hastings - All Hell Let Loose; the World at War, 1939-1945 (2011)

-  Hastings - Catastrophe; Europe Goes to War 1914 (2013)

-  Hosch (Ed.) - America at War, World War I; People, Politics, and Power (Britannica, 2010)

-  Hosch (Ed.) - America at War, World War II; People, Politics, and Power (Britannica, 2010)

-  Kettenacker & Riotte (Ed.) - The Legacies of Two World Wars; European Societies in the 20th Century (2011)

-  Lowe - Savage Continent; Europe in the Aftermath of World War II (2012)

-  MacMillan - Paris 1919; Six Months That Changed the World (2002)

-  McDonough (Ed.) - The Origins of the Second World War; an International Perspective (2011)

-  McMillan - The War That Ended Peace; How Europe Abandoned Peace for the First World War (2013)

-  Overy & Wheatcroft - The Road to War (1999)

-  Pipe - World War One; a Very Peculiar History (2012)

-  Pipe - World War Two; a Very Peculiar History (2012)

-  Slavicek - The Treaty of Versailles (2010)

-  Steiner - The Lights That Failed; European International History, 1919-1933 (2005)

-  Steiner - The Triumph of the Dark; European International History, 1933-1939 (2011)

-  van Emden - Boy Soldiers of the Great War (2012)

-  Weinberg - A World At Arms; A Global History Of World War II (1994)

-  Withuis & Mooij (Eds.) - The Politics of War Trauma; the Aftermath of World War II in Eleven European Countries (2010)
